messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: unschooling conference
messages.msgSnippet: There ya go Kelly,  looks like you re off the hook again.   I would love for it to be in SD also.  Not only is it closer for me  but I ve heard from so
messages.messageBody:
There ya go Kelly, looks like you're off the hook again. <g>

I would love for it to be in SD also. Not only is it closer for me <g> but I've heard from so many people that there are so many interesting things there. I can't believe I haven't done a lot of them, with it only be 4-6 hours away from me. Lots of history, rocks/stones, and the Mammoth dig, are a few things that come to mind.

Kelli~



<<<Honestly though, Sioux Falls is an amazing
> family-friendly place>>>


***Of all the states we
visited, I was MOST impressed with South Dakota. I could not
believe how much there was to see and do there and how astonishingly
beautiful it was.***





Taunya Hedbor <thedbor@...> wrote:
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "diana jenner"
<hahamommy@s...> wrote:
EVERYONE ('cept for me, Kelli & Melanie) should drive 1200+ miles
and know
> that it's WORTH IT!! Honestly though, Sioux Falls is an amazing
> family-friendly place, not at all *vegas like* in atmosphere,
close enough
> to big cities, should families want that kind of entertainment,
but far
> enough away for families to feel like this is really a VACATION
and not a

I have to second this motion... or at least say - that if nothing
else, it should come here on it's way back the next time around...
about 8 years ago we moved to Oregon and drove from Vermont all the
way across the country to our new home. Of all the states we
visited, I was MOST impressed with South Dakota. I could not
believe how much there was to see and do there and how astonishingly
beautiful it was. I have not yet made it back - but it's definitely
on my list of places to tour...

Taunya

-----Original Message-----
From: kbcdlovejo@... [mailto:kbcdlovejo@...]
Sent: Wednesday, September 08, 2004 8:02 AM
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] unschooling conference

In a message dated 9/8/2004 10:38:43 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
davenshan@... writes:

So Kelly, will you be *living* in St. Louis?<<<<

No, but I *have* lived in Belleville, IL, just over the river. I still have
lots of contacts---and I know the area. I'll be going up a few times for
scouting and contract signings----and I won't be complaining. <g>

We were stationed there @Scott AFB in the early '90s. When I found out we
were moving to the Midwest, I almost divorced Ben! <G> I thought I was
moving
to the armpit of the country. To my surprise, I fell in LOVE with the area.

I have a place to stay while working on it, plus I get to visit with an old
friend. Be good for me all around.

I really like the idea of the "Travelling Unschooling Show." <g> I like
visiting different parts of the country---and I think others do too. This
will
also give locals the opportunity to show off their state/region as well as
everyone else to see different parts of the country each year.

It truly doesn't seem to matter *where* it's held----People came for two
years to little old Columbia, SC, for Holt's sake. <g> If it travels, maybe
more
people, like---ahem---BETSY!, will be able to participate----if not every
year, then maybe every three or four?

Why, is that *your* home? <g> Do I have an assistant? <g>

~Kelly

James wants the conference to take over a cruise. He is envisioning a week
in the Caribbean or Bahamas, starting from one of the ports that go down
there.

Talks and funshops while sailing, doing cool things with other Unschoolers
in the stops, and fabulous food included in the price. That is his wildest
dream conference.

Robyn L. Coburn

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] unschooling conference
messages.msgSnippet: ... From:  To:  Sent: Wednesday, 08 September, 2004 4:56 AM Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion]
messages.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: <kbcdlovejo@...>
To: <UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, 08 September, 2004 4:56 AM
Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] unschooling conference


> 2006 will probably be in St Louis. I like St Louis, and I'm thinking my
> hiatus will be long enough that I'll want it back by then---at least for a
year.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

Any special reason for St. Louis?? I ask because I am really wanting to
coordinate a L&L Conference in Sioux Falls, SD ~ mostly because I think
EVERYONE ('cept for me, Kelli & Melanie) should drive 1200+ miles and know
that it's WORTH IT!! Honestly though, Sioux Falls is an amazing
family-friendly place, not at all *vegas like* in atmosphere, close enough
to big cities, should families want that kind of entertainment, but far
enough away for families to feel like this is really a VACATION and not a
spend-fest. Our mall, for the shoppers, is the world's largest single-story;
our zoo is fun; we've a children's science center (reciprocates with most
national museums) with an art pavilion (free); and we've got lots of parks.
There's an airport worth the extra $50 to fly into ~ it's tiny and friendly!
There has to be a hotel in town small enough for us to take over and still
big enough to meet our conference room needs. I am sincere in my offer...
should we do St. Louis anyway, I'm pretty close and willing to help with
whatever it takes to make L&L happen nearby!! :)

~diana :)


---

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] unschooling conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/7/2004 7:00:13 PM Eastern Daylight Time, dezigna@comcast.net writes: My  understanding is that 2006 is vacant at the moment, and a
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/7/2004 7:00:13 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
dezigna@... writes:

My understanding is that 2006 is vacant at the moment, and a midwest
destination being sought, but 2007 has been bagged by San Diego - official
confirmation will follow eventually I guess.<<<<

2006 will probably be in St Louis. I like St Louis, and I'm thinking my
hiatus will be long enough that I'll want it back by then---at least for a year.

2007 is tentatively requested by Rebecca, but she has yet to attend a
conference, just moved, and is expecting---or just had---a new baby. It may be more
than she can handle! <G> She'll be at the next two, and we'll hold her hand.
If she decides NOT to, we've had two other offers on the west coast, so
we'll see.

Maryland/DC area has requested 2008. <g>

Then we'll work our way back across the country!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/4/2004 7:07:27 PM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:

I just went to the homeschooling conference in Sacramento for
the first time and was pleased to be able to purchase tapes of speakers I
wanted to share with my husband who could not attend--or those speakers I
was unable to hear but wanted to. Did those at the unschooling conference
tape their speakers and are they available for purchase?


*******************************
We have to process the recordings and arrange for copying, but they WILL be
available. I'll post it here as soon as they are.

Kathryn, Conference Coordinator

KathrynJB@... to ask about those from the Massachusetts conference.

kbcdlovejo@... has tapes from the two prior conferences in South
Carolina.

I have some here (SandraDodd@...). I have
Peaceful Parenting
Practicalities of Unschooling
To Question or Not to Question

The first and third are duets with Richard Prystowsky, from three years or
so
ago. The other is me, an intro to unschooling.

I can take paypal, $7 each to cover postage and some packing stuff (I sold
them for $6 at the conference t'other day).

Sandra

Sandra, would you send them overseas (Australia) and if so, how much more
would it cost?

Julie

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/4/04 10:27:56 AM, geolear@... writes:

<< I new to the group and unschooling and am interested in the discussions

about being a YES parent and presume this is from a speaker at the

conference. >>

Not from a speaker, but from someone who went and got pretty excited about
things. <g>

-= Did those at the unschooling conference

tape their speakers and are they available for purchase? -=-

There are tapes from last year already available, and there should be CDs
from this year available soon.

HSC also has some tapes from previous years (and I have some from HSC
conferences of me, and of me and Richard Prystowsky, of my own).

unschooling conference ever be held on the west coast? -=-

Maybe.
San Francisco was thrown out as a maybe, but next year (2005) it will be in
Pensacola, Florida (northwestern Florida).

Sandra

messages.subject: unschooling conference
messages.msgSnippet: I new to the group and unschooling and am interested in the discussions about being a YES parent and presume this is from a speaker at the conference.  I just
messages.messageBody:
I new to the group and unschooling and am interested in the discussions
about being a YES parent and presume this is from a speaker at the
conference. I just went to the homeschooling conference in Sacramento for
the first time and was pleased to be able to purchase tapes of speakers I
wanted to share with my husband who could not attend--or those speakers I
was unable to hear but wanted to. Did those at the unschooling conference
tape their speakers and are they available for purchase? Will the
unschooling conference ever be held on the west coast? It sounded like so
much fun and very interesting. I had heard the homeschooling conference
was fun but was amazed at how wonderful and helpful it was. Jana Lear,
mom to eight year old Arlo.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] unschooling conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/11/2003 4:09:32 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Geri, The School s Out Support Live & Learn Unschooling Conference, Columbia, SC, August
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/11/2003 4:09:32 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
> Is there a web page on the conference you all are talking about?
> What is the title, location and date?
>
> Thanks in Advance.

Geri,

The School's Out Support Live & Learn Unschooling Conference, Columbia, SC,
August 22-24, 2003. Speakers: Pam Sorooshian, Anne Ohamn, Mary Gold, and
Sandra Dodd. Jim Weiss, storyteller.

http://www.schoolsoutsupport.org/events.html

~Kelly
Kelly Lovejoy, Coordinator
Schools Out Support
mailto:coordinator@...
803-776-4849
Fax: 803-776-7006
http://www.schoolsoutsupport.org

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: unschooling conference
messages.msgSnippet: These are so many of my questions!!  Are you guys going to tape it, and offer the tapes for sale?  Debi ... learn? How do you unschool? Why does unschooling
messages.messageBody:
These are so many of my questions!! Are you guys going to tape it, and offer the tapes for sale? Debi
>>Do you have any of the following questions or concerns? How do children
learn? How do you unschool? Why does unschooling work? Can Christians
unschool? Who can't unschool? How do you get rid of the school mindset? What
about math? What about college? What
happens when unschoolers grow up? How do you "trust" your child? What is
meant by "strewing their paths"? TV, computers. video games: are these
educational? All these questions and more will be answered!


Yahoo! Groups Sponsor
ADVERTISEMENT

messages.subject: Re: unschooling conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/29/2002 7:56:40 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... South Carolina. South  Carolina. SOUTH CAROLINA! You re not the only one, Ren!  About the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/29/2002 7:56:40 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
> I am currently putting together a sort of geographical type trade for anyone
>
> that is attending the conference in NC this October. Each of us bringing
> something unique to our area to share with some unschooling.commies.
> If you're coming to the conference and interested in participating, you can
>
> find the discussion at www.unschooling.com under the Classified section.
> Hope to see you there!
>

South Carolina. South Carolina. SOUTH CAROLINA!

You're not the only one, Ren! <g>

About the conference:

Do you have any of the following questions or concerns? How do children
learn? How do you unschool? Why does unschooling work? Can Christians
unschool? Who can't unschool? How do you get rid of the school mindset? What
about math? What about college? What about "special needs" children? What
happens when unschoolers grow up? How do you "trust" your child? What is
meant by "strewing their paths"? TV, computers. video games: are these
educational? All these questions and more will be answered!

There will be magicians, storytellers, artists, and more to entertain and
inspire you and your children! There will be no age-discrimination: all ages
may participate in any and all presentations/funshops. Bring the whole family
for a joy-filled weekend!

Featured presenters: Sandra Dodd, Anne Ohman, Lisa Bugg, & Joyce Fetteroll
from the unschooling.com message boards, Ned Vare & Luz Shosie, parents of a
grown unschooler; and Fiona Hutchison, herself unschooled and daytime star of
"One Life to Live".

For more information, visit our website, http://www.schoolsoutsupport.org

I hope you all can join us!

Kelly




Kelly Lovejoy, Coordinator
Schools Out Support
